lines.text: You know something, Amos? The Lord poured your brains in with a teaspoon, and somebody joggled His arm. I keep trying to tell you we ain't got no lead to throw, and no powder to throw it with.
Will you stop tryin' to think!
Amos, that's the most humiliating thing that's ever happened to me.
I know.
Three bitty kids with shovels walk right into our hideout and get the drop on us.
I know.
And you burnt my hand, Amos.
Well, I'm sorry about that.
And you scorched a hole in my best shirt!
Well, I can fix that.

[suddenly blows his top]
Why did you tell me those three bitty kids were a posse?
Well, I thought I saw them hiding down there in the bushes.
Oh, you couldn't see through a barbed-wire fence!
Theodore?
That head of yours wouldn't hold straw!
Theodore?
You couldn't sell hacksaws in a jail!
How much money do you figure that dude's got in front of him?
About five hundred.
Five hundred? Wow! You know, that'll be, uh, that's two hundred apiece!
[Dusty is trying to beat him up]
Dusty, will you just let me say one word?
One!
Dusty...
That's it!
You always kiss like that?
I've been saving up.
Donovan? Yes you, you snake oil salesman! Are you coming out here or am I coming in there?
What's the matter, Dusty? Is there some trouble?
Yes, there's trouble all right! And you're in it!
Mr. Donovan, I gotta go.

[beat]
But you just went.
I gotta go again.
That's impossible! Go to sleep.
I'm gonna have an accident!

[Dusty and Donovan are in the middle of their bar room brawl]
What happened with them two?
They got married.

[coming to after Dusty knocks him out with a spitoon and sees her coming at him again]
Dusty! Dusty! Would you just tell me what's bothering you?!

[grabbing Donovan by the jacket]
That bed! That great, big, brass bed! If you had no intention of exercising your husbandly prerogatives, why'd you buy that bed?
That's it? The *bed*?
*Yes*!

[holds her hands away from him]
The bed happens to be for the kids, Dusty. When the nights are getting colder, they'll need a *warmer* place to sleep. So the brass bed is for the boys, and the smaller bed is for *Celia*!

[sweetly]
Well, why didn't you say so in the first place, then we could have avoided this little misunderstanding.
[frees her hands and walks through the mess in the bar over to the door where Celia is sitting]

[takes her hand]
Come along, Celia. This is no place for a lady.
Welcome to Quake City, Donovan. Looks like luck is against you.
Well, there's one good thing about luck - it always changes. And I got a feeling mine is just around the corner.
Donovan! I haven't seen you since, ah...
Santa Fe.
Right!
When you sold me the Marshal's horse.
Right. I was just funnin', Donovan.
The Marshal wasn't amused.
This court is now in session, the Honorable Homer McCoy presiding. Theodore Ogelvie, Amos Tucker, you're charged with attempted bank robbery. How do you plead? Guilty or not guilty?
Not guilty?
Guilty!
That was the wrong one.
This court sentences you to be hung by the neck until dead. And I'm fining you an extra ten bucks for perjury. Let 'em out.
[Amos and Ted are let out of the cage]
Be down at the old oak tree near Boot Hill at twelve o'clock sharp for your hanging. And bring your own rope.
Anytime you got one of them down-home sheriffs, you always got a town full of vigilantes.
I've never teamed two more unlikely prospects. You two go together like ice cream and whiskey. But I guess you'd be man and wife same as regular people, and nobody could say different.
You know something, Amos?
Huh?
We got to make a decision.
What?
Does the Hash Knife Outfit throw in its hand? Or do we go out in a blaze of glory?
Right! Uh, just what do you mean... blaze of glory?
Fighting till the last man's killed! What's it going to be, pard?
You know that jail in Santa Fe wasn't all that bad.

Donovan, this is just a half portion of a town, but we do have certain what you might call rules to live by! You don't jump another man's claim; you don't steal his wife, woman or whiskey; you don't strike a bargain and then entertain second thoughts about the matter. Any one of these offenses could make you the exalted guest of honor at a hemp party.
If you need a haircut, Wintle, my barbershop's closed. If you're lookin' to sue somebody, my court's open every Tuesday. If you want the sheriff, I'm playin' poker. Deuces bet a dollar.
Clovis don't like to be touched.

[looking skyward, trying to talk to God]
What have I done to deserve this?
Who are you talking to?
It doesn't matter. I don't think He's listening to me anyway.

You and me been through a lot together, and although I climbed your hump once in a while, I - I just couldn't have asked for a better partner. If we meet again in that big roundup in the sky sometime, I'm gonna spread my blanket 'side of yours, just the same as always.
It's a piece of cake.
You mean it ain't gold?
You're rear end's on fire, Theodore.
Oh. Thank you.
[Jumps and frantically slaps fire out; glares at Amos]
Why didn't you tell me my rear end was on fire?
Well, you said not to do anything to attract attention.
Dusty's a fine specimen of womanhood! I seen her get caught in a cloudburst once, and I wanna to tell you!
Three 'widdle' kids? Three little swindlers, you mean.

[to Amos, about a ladder]
Get back, you cabbage head! You're gonna bust it!
Where's your friend?
He better be in another county!
You two couldn't steal candy from a baby without coming out on the short end.
You don't thank a man for hanging you, you leather-brained ignoramus.
That's two bits.
But I've only got half a shave!
A whole shave's four bits. Now git before I fine you for loitering.
We want you to have our gold nugget.
What gold nugget is that?
The one you tried to steal.
Oh, that gold nugget.
Uh, still aren't mad 'cause I shot you in the leg, are you, Frank?
I'm gonna buy some new toes.
Donovan? I'm sorry I hit you in the head with the spitoon.

[smiles]
A perfectly logical misunderstanding. And I'm sorry I offered to buy you a drink in the saloon, too.
A perfectly logical misunderstanding.
Well, I wouldn't make that mistake again.
You wouldn't?

[steps closer, looks as if he's about to kiss her - then he shakes her hand instead]
Good luck, Dusty.
What's that?
Salt pork.
[beat]
I think.
It looks like fat.
Well, whatever it, it's dinner.

[disgusted]
That's dinner?
That's dinner!

[Donovan's been trying all day to pawn the orphans off on someone else]
Ah, the lady of the house!

[drops her empty gin bottle and it shatters]
Kids, yick!
The children are marvelous about parties. They love parties themselves!

[to her husband as she drags him back inside and starts to close the door on him]
Come on!
If you'd just take one small look...
[she slams the door]
Who was that?

[flatly]
That was the president of the garden club.
If I ever get within shootin' distance of that doggone Amos Tucker, he's gonna have "winders" where his ears was.
I'm leaving for San Francisco tonight.
San Francisco's loss is Quake City's gain.
When Mr. Stockley gets mad, he uses words I've never heard before.
